metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13075 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: Tor Browser through 8.5.3 has an information exposure vulnerability. It allows remote attackers to detect the browser's language via vectors involving an IFRAME element, because text in that language is included in the title attribute of a LINK element for a non-HTML page. This is related to a behavior of Firefox before 68.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> doesn't affect firefox by itself fixed in firefox 68

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
